page.title: List of tools to create Live USB systems

rev.diff:
Line 2: Line 2:
*[[UNetbootin]] ([[Ubuntu]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], and many others). Uses [[syslinux]] without formatting a device.
*[[UNetbootin]] ([[Ubuntu]], [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]], and many others). Uses [[syslinux]] without formatting a device.
*[[Ubuntu USB desktop image creator]] ([[Ubuntu]]) This tool is officialy developed by the Ubuntu Installation Team.
*[[Ubuntu USB desktop image creator]] ([[Ubuntu]]) This tool is officialy developed by the Ubuntu Installation Team.
â
*[[Ubuntu Live USB creator]] ([[Ubuntu]]) Uses [[syslinux]] and does format the device, creating one [[FAT32]] partition.
+
*[[Live USB system creator]] ([[Ubuntu]]) Uses [[syslinux]] and does format the device, creating one [[FAT32]] partition.
*[[Fedora Live USB creator]] ([[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]])
*[[Fedora Live USB creator]] ([[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]])
*[http://maledivenhilfe.com/liveusb-creator/ sidux USB installer] ([[sidux]]) (based on Fedora Live USB creator)
*[http://maledivenhilfe.com/liveusb-creator/ sidux USB installer] ([[sidux]]) (based on Fedora Live USB creator)
